result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan J Grissett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan J Grissett appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Jonathan J Grissett.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Court sets matter for a scheduling conference and motion hearing and reschedules the jury trial. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan J Grissett appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jonathan J Grissett.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel filed several motions. Due to the nature of the motions, Court is unable to accommodate the speedy trial. For reasons stated on the record, Court grants a continuance of the speedy trial demand. For reasons stated on the record, Court sets matter for a status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for admission of 911 recording, filed.
to suppress evidence obtained through warrantless entry into home for arrest, filed.
to introduce evidence implicating a third party (Denny), filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Response in Opposition to Joinder, filed.
to suppress statements, filed.
for joinder, filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
RESCINDING defendant's communication privileges, signed and filed.

Defendant Jonathan J Grissett appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jonathan J Grissett.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court. Court RESCINDES defendant's telephone, visitation, and U.S. mail custody privileges. Order, signed and filed. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 29.
filed.
State requests a bail/bond hearing. Bail/bond hearing set for 10/4/22 at 2:00 pm. Parties notified via email.
State's motion to rescind communication privileges, filed.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same, including electronic monitoring.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 12/8/22.

Defendant Jonathan J Grissett not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Jonathan J Grissett.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court. Court sets cash bail at $50,000.00. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court vacates the scheduling conference on 9/19/22 at 8:30 am. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State requests a bail/bond hearing. Bail/bond hearing set for 9/9/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified.
to increase bail, filed.

Defendant Jonathan J Grissett appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Jonathan J Grissett.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Tracy. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Jonathan J Grissett not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v Lee hearing. Defense counsel was recently appointed. Parties request an adjournment of the preliminary hearing previously scheduled for 8/31/22. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan J Grissett not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan J Grissett not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative that it be set for status of counsel; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD status of counsel, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Johnathan J Grissett not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available. 24 HOUR CURFEW/MONITORING.

Defendant Johnathan J Grissett in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke, as a friend of the court.  Defendant Johnathan J Grissett in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
State requests a bail/bond hearing. Bail/bond hearing set for 6/9/22 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified via email.
to increase bail, filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MH, JG, CC, and AJG.

Defendant Johnathan J Grissett in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Johnathan J Grissett in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnathan J Grissett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
